net.rim.device.api.lbs.picker
Class ContactsLocationPicker

java.lang.Object
  net.rim.device.api.ui.Field
      net.rim.device.api.ui.ScrollView
          net.rim.device.api.ui.Manager
              net.rim.device.api.ui.Screen
                  net.rim.device.api.ui.container.PopupScreen
                      net.rim.device.api.lbs.picker.AbstractLocationPicker
                          net.rim.device.api.lbs.picker.ContactsLocationPicker
All Implemented Interfaces:
LocationPicker.Picker, AdjustmentListener, FieldChangeListener
public class ContactsLocationPicker
extends AbstractLocationPicker

The ContactsLocationPicker provides the ability for a user to select an address from their Contacts. The location selected may optionally be validated by geocoding the address. If the address cannot be geocoded the user will be prompted to update or accept the unvalidated address.

Category:
Signed: This element is only accessible by signed applications. If you intend to use this element, please visit http://www.blackberry.com/go/codesigning to obtain a set of code signing keys. Code signing is only required for applications running on BlackBerry smartphones; development on BlackBerry Smartphone Simulators can occur without code signing.
Since:
BlackBerry API 5.0.0

Constructor Detail

ContactsLocationPicker

protected ContactsLocationPicker(Manager delegate,
                                 boolean geocode)
Construct a ContactsLocationPicker

Parameters:
delegate - Manager this screen uses as a layout delegate.
geocode - the location. If set to true and the response cannot be geocoded the user will be prompted to update the location, or continue with the location without an geocoded information.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if manager passed in is null.
ControlledAccessException - If the application does not have PERMISSION_ORGANIZER_DATA permission
ControlledAccessException - If the application does not have PERMISSION_LOCATION_DATA permission and geocode = true
Category:
Signed: This element is only accessible by signed applications. If you intend to use this element, please visit http://www.blackberry.com/go/codesigning to obtain a set of code signing keys. Code signing is only required for applications running on BlackBerry smartphones; development on BlackBerry Smartphone Simulators can occur without code signing.
Since:
BlackBerry API 5.0.0
